diagrams.title: User diagram

threats.title: Login as another user
threats.description: Attacker logs in as another user
threats.mitigation: Email pin verification

threats.title: User denies logging in
threats.description: User denies that they logged in
threats.mitigation: Log login information, authenticate strongly

threats.title: Register as another user
threats.description: Attacker registers under another user's email
threats.mitigation: Verification of email using a pin

threats.title: User denies registering
threats.description: User denies that they registered
threats.mitigation: Log emailed pin being used (e.g., they verified their email)

threats.title: Modifying user details in transit
threats.description: Attacker modifies user details in transit
threats.mitigation: Signing packets, and store data on a private server so that it is not publicly accessible.

threats.title: Leaked user details
threats.description: Attacker retrieves user's details as it transits from server to database
threats.mitigation: Using encrypted transport layer protocol such as TLS, or store data locally

threats.title: Flood database with bad messages
threats.description: Attacker floods the database with bad messages of user details
threats.mitigation: Store data locally, protect network with a firewall and utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

data.name: Personal Details
data.description:
User details include:
  * unique username
  * unique email address

threats.title: Modify personal details in transit
threats.description: Attacker modifies personal details in transit so the user cannot use their own account
threats.mitigation: Transit data over secure layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Retrieval of personal details
threats.description: Attacker retrieves user details
threats.mitigation: Message is encrypted using clients private key/session token

threats.title: Flood bad registration messages to server
threats.description: Attacker floods server with bad registration messages
threats.mitigation: Utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Stopping registration message
threats.description: Attacker intercepts and stops registration message being sent from client to server
threats.mitigation: Send message over a secure protocol layer

threats.title: Modification of user signin details
threats.description: Attacker modifies user login details to prevent them from logging in
threats.mitigation: Sign user login details, and use HTTPS

threats.title: Retrieval of login details
threats.description: Attacker retrieves login details when data goes from client to server
threats.mitigation: Send over secure layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Client floods server with bad requests
threats.description: Attacker sends a bunch of bad requests to the server
threats.mitigation: Utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

data.name:
Retrieve Login Data Associated 
With Username

threats.title: Modify user details
threats.description: Attacker modifies the user details (e.g., email) so that the user cannot login and the attacker can.
threats.mitigation: Use a secure protocol such as TLS

threats.title: Retrieval of user details in transit
threats.description: Attacker retrieves user details in transit from datastore to server
threats.mitigation: Use secure transit protocol such as HTTPS

threats.title: Flood the server with bad user detail responses
threats.description: Attacker floods the server with bad user detail responses
threats.mitigation: Store data on a private network so that attackers cannot interfere, use a firewall, and utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

labels:
Retrieve Login Data Associated 
With Username

threats.title: Modify ID
threats.description: Attacker modifies the ID while in transit from the datastore to the server
threats.mitigation: Sign the message with the server's private key.

threats.title: Leaked ID
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the user's ID while in transit from the datastore to the server.
threats.mitigation: Use of HTTPS, or encrypting message

threats.title: Flood bad IDs
threats.description: Attacker floods server with bad IDs
threats.mitigation: Avoid public facing datastore, use a firewall and utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Modify confirmation
threats.description: Attacker modifies confirmation to inform the user that their registration was not confirmed
threats.mitigation: Sign confirmation message with server's private key

threats.title: Retrieval of client signing up
threats.description: Attacker finds out that client signed up
threats.mitigation: Encrypt confirmation message

threats.title: Modify confirmation
threats.description: Attacker modifies confirmation to inform the user that their registration was not confirmed, client may now think they do not have an account
threats.mitigation: Sign confirmation message with server's private key

threats.title: Modify login details
threats.description: Attacker modifies user details in transit so the user cannot login
threats.mitigation: Signing, and private network

threats.title: Modify login details
threats.description: Attacker modifies user details in transit so the user cannot login
threats.mitigation: Signing, and secure private network

threats.title: Retrives login details
threats.description: Attacker retrieves login details
threats.mitigation: Send data over encrypted transport layer such as TLS

threats.title: Flood server with bad requests
threats.description: Attacker floods server with bad requests to overwhelm it
threats.mitigation: Put server on a private network, use a firewall and utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Modify session token
threats.description: Attacker modifies session token such that the user cannot use it to login
threats.mitigation: Sign session token with server's private key

threats.title: Retrieval of session token
threats.description: Attacker retrieves session token in transit
threats.mitigation: Send session token over secure transport layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Modify session token
threats.description: Attacker modifies session token such that the user cannot use it to login
threats.mitigation: Sign session token with server's private key

threats.title: External actor retrieves Session Token
threats.description: Attacker retrieves user's current session token from the datastore.
threats.mitigation: Store data locally without public entry points, and only accept messages signed by server

threats.title: Modify user data
threats.description: attacker modifies user data in store
threats.mitigation: authenticate requests with signing them, and store data on a private network

threats.title: Modify user session token
threats.description: Attacker modifies user session token in data store
threats.mitigation: authenticate requests with signing them, and store data on a private network

threats.title: User denies accessing application
threats.description: User denies accessing the application and signing in
threats.mitigation: Log information, and authenticate users strongly

threats.title: Removal/modification of user data
threats.description: Attacker removes or modifies user data so that the user cannot sign in
threats.mitigation: authenticate requests with signing them, and store data on a private network

threats.title: Internal actor retrieves user credentials
threats.description: Attacker with internal access to datastore retrieves data from the datastore
threats.mitigation:
Ensure those with internal access to the datastore are only permitted when they need it
Log internal access to the datastore
Encrypt data in the datastore

data.name: Register
data.description: Action to register a user account to the ShareNote app

threats.title: Register someone else for the service
threats.description: Attacker registers another user for the service
threats.mitigation: Require email verification for registration to complete

threats.title: Modify username or email
threats.description: Attacker modifies username or email in transit
threats.mitigation: Signing or using HTTPS

threats.title: User denies registration
threats.description: User denies that they registered
threats.mitigation: Log registration data and ensure verification of who you are when registering

threats.title: Retrieve user details
threats.description: Attacker retrieves user details (email)
threats.mitigation: Encrypt user data

threats.title: Flood server with many requests
threats.description: Attacker floods the register end-point with a lot of requests
threats.mitigation: Utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Fake register page
threats.description: Attacker phishes for credentials using a fake website with a slightly different URL
threats.mitigation: Don't use links to the website in marketing/emails

data.name: Login
data.description: Take login details (username, email), fetch login details associated with the given username, ensure that these match the given login detais (e.g. email is correct), create a session token if it is correct, and return this to the user

threats.title: Logging in as another user
threats.description: Attacker logs in as another user
threats.mitigation: User is sent pin when logging in for authentication

threats.title: Modifying user details
threats.description: Attacker modifies user data on transit
threats.mitigation: Send data over secure data layer

threats.title: User denies logging in
threats.description: User denies logging in to their account
threats.mitigation: Logging usage information, and strong login authentication

threats.title: Modifying user details
threats.description: Attacker modifies user data on transit so that the user cannot sign in
threats.mitigation: Send data over secure data layer (HTTPS/TLS)

threats.title: Flooding server with messages
threats.description: Attacker floods end-point with bad messages
threats.mitigation: Utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Fake login page
threats.description: Attacker phishes for credentials using a fake website with a slightly different URL
threats.mitigation:
Don't use links to the website in marketing/emails
Educate the community on potential phishing attacks

threats.title: Interception of Session Token in Transit
threats.description: Attacker intercepts the session token and username pair in transit to the datastore
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

diagrams.description: Presents the user signup and login

threats.title: Pretend to be another user
threats.description: Attacker pretends to be a user that they are not using their credentials
threats.mitigation: Email verification when logging in, and email verification when sharing (both using an emailed pin)

threats.title: User denies sharing note
threats.description: The user denies sharing their note
threats.mitigation: Logging usage and strong authentication using emailed pin

data.name:
Privilege
Configuration
data.description:
Sharing settings (whether users can read or edit)
- list of users and access level

threats.title: Modify user in message
threats.description: Attacker adds or removes a user from the message in transit
threats.mitigation: Send message over a secure transport protocol (HTTPS)

threats.title: Modify user access in message
threats.description: Attacker modifies the access level of a user(s) in the message
threats.mitigation: Send message over a secure transport protocol (HTTPS)

threats.title: Retrieval of note privilege configuration
threats.description: Attacker retrieves note privilege configuration message
threats.mitigation: Encrypt message using client's private key or HTTPS

threats.title: Flood server with bad requests
threats.description: Attacker floods the server with a large number of bad requests for the privilege config end point
threats.mitigation: Utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

data.name: Sharing link
data.description: Link for user to distribute to other users

threats.title: Modify shared link id
threats.description: Attacker changed id of note that link points to. This might give them the ability to point to their own note (that is shared), and trick users into believing that this is the note they were trying to access.
threats.mitigation: Send message over a secure transport protocol (HTTPS)

threats.title: Retrieval of shared link
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the shared link
threats.mitigation: Encrypt message using server's private key, or use HTTPS

data.name: Update Note Priveleges
data.description: Link for user to distribute to other users

threats.title: Modify note privilege
threats.description: Attacker modifies the privileges of a note when this message is in transit
threats.mitigation: Transport messages from client to server over a secure protocol layer (TLS), or store data privately without public entry points

threats.title: Retrieval of note privilege message
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the note privilege message in transit
threats.mitigation: Encryption of packets using end to end encryption or server's private key, or store data privately without public entry points.

threats.title: Modification of comment content
threats.description: Attacker modifies/removes privilege changes in transit
threats.mitigation: Send packets over a secure protocol layer (TLS) or store data privately without a public entry point

threats.title: Flooding datastore with bad messages
threats.description: Attacker floods the datastore with bad messages, overwhelming it and making it slow to respond
threats.mitigation: Do not allow the datastore to be accessed publicly (e.g. no public access points), use a firewall, and utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Privilege change pointed to different note
threats.description: Attacker modifies the note that the privilege change is pointed to (e.g., instead of giving user A access to note A, the attacker changes the message to give them access to note B).
threats.mitigation: Transport messages from client to server over a secure protocol layer (TLS), or store data privately without public entry points

data.name: Sharing link
data.reasonOutOfScope: The link can be shared via email or any other external service (e.g. SMS)

data.name:
ShareNote 
secured infrastructure

& 

Trust Level 1
data.description: Process can only be completed by a note owner

threats.title: Modified ID
threats.description: Attacker modifies the returned ID in transit - leading to an incorrect share link being created
threats.mitigation: Sign messages from datastore, or store the data privately and don't have a public entry point.

threats.title: Modified ID
threats.description: Attacker modifies the returned ID in transit - leading to an incorrect share link being created
threats.mitigation: Sign messages from datastore, or store the data privately and don't have a public entry point.

threats.title: Retrieval of Note ID
threats.description: Attacker retrieves note ID in transit - could lead to reverse engineering the shared link generation
threats.mitigation:
Encryption of packets using end to end encryption, TLS, or datastore's private key 
Have a private datastore that doesn't require transport over a public network

threats.title: Pretending to be Note Owner
threats.description: The attacker pretends to be a the Note Owner (TL1), giving themselves the ability to create a share link for the note and add users with privileges.
threats.mitigation: Have email 2FA before generating a link or updating share note privileges.

threats.title: Alter target note
threats.description: An attacker could change the note which the privilege update is targeted towards.
threats.mitigation: Check that datastore to check that the user updating the note privileges is the Note Owner.

threats.title: SQL injection
threats.description: Attacker uses SQL injection
threats.mitigation: Sanitise incoming SQL queries

threats.title: SQL injection
threats.description: Attacker using SQL injection to remove data from the datastore
threats.mitigation: Sanitise incoming SQL queries

threats.title: User denies sharing a note with someone
threats.description: User denies that their shared note was shared by them to someone
threats.mitigation: Log usage when sharing note, and have strong authentication for sharing links (e.g. emailed pin auth)

threats.title: Internal actor retrieves shared users and link
threats.description: Attacker with internal access to datastore retrieves data from the datastore
threats.mitigation:
Ensure those with internal access to the datastore are only permitted when they need it
Log internal access to the datastore
Encrypt data in the datastore

threats.title: External actor retrieves shared users and link
threats.description: External actor uses phony SQL request to retrieve shared users and link
threats.mitigation: Store data locally without public entry points, and only accept messages signed by server

threats.title: SQL injection
threats.description: Attacker uses SQL injection to give themself privilege to view a note
threats.mitigation: Sanitise incoming SQL queries

data.name: Share Link
data.reasonOutOfScope: The link can be shared via email or any other external service (e.g. SMS)

threats.title: Sending comment as another user
threats.description: Attacker sends comment as another user
threats.mitigation: Email code for verification before sending a comment

threats.title: User denies sending a comment
threats.description: User denies sending a comment
threats.mitigation: Log user's access of the website, their login and authentication, and their email verification when sending a comment

threats.title: Deleting comment as another user
threats.description: Attacker deletes a comment pretending to be another user
threats.mitigation: Email code for verification before deleting a comment

threats.title: User denies deleting a comment
threats.description: User denies deleting a comment
threats.mitigation: Log user's access of the website, their login and authentication, and their email verification when deleting a comment

data.name: Delete request
data.description:
User wants to delete comment
- user specifies the ID of the comment that they delete

threats.title: Modify the delete request message
threats.description: Attacker modifies the delete request to not delete the message
threats.mitigation: Transport messages from client to server over a secure protocol layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Retrieval of delete comment request
threats.description: Attacker retrieves that a user wants to delete their comment
threats.mitigation: N/A because this information cannot be used to threaten the user, and the user will still delete their comment

threats.title: Removal of delete request
threats.description: Attacker intercepts the delete request and removes it entirely
threats.mitigation: Send packets over a secure protocol layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Flooding server with bad messages
threats.description: Attacker floods the server's delete request end-point with bad messages, which means that the server does not have the time to process legitimate messages
threats.mitigation: Utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Change the comment to be deleted
threats.description: The attacker changes the ID of the comment to delete to be another comment that the user has written
threats.mitigation: Send messages over a secure layer protocol (HTTPS), notify the user of deleted messages and allow for an undo.

data.name:
Comment
content
data.description: Text of comment

threats.title: Modify the content of a comment
threats.description: Attacker modifies the content of a comment - may be inappropriate, rude, or break TOS.
threats.mitigation: Transport messages from client to server over a secure protocol layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Retrieval of comment content
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the content of a comment - may not be that bad if a note is public, but could contain personal data if the note is private.
threats.mitigation: Encryption of packets using end to end encryption or client's private key.

threats.title: Removal of comment content
threats.description: Attacker removes content or intercepts the comment, and the comment is not posted
threats.mitigation: Send packets over a secure protocol layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Flooding server with bad messages
threats.description: Attacker floods the server's comment end-point with bad messages, which means that the server does not have the time to process legitimate messages
threats.mitigation: Utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Request to delete comment is wiped
threats.description: Attacker wipes the request to delete a comment, and no comment is deleted
threats.mitigation: Sign messages using the server's private key, or store the data privately and don't have a public entry point.

threats.title: Request changed to delete another comment of the same user's
threats.description: The request is changed to specify a comment id of a different comment owned by the same user
threats.mitigation: Sign messages using the server's private key, or store the data privately and don't have a public entry point.

threats.title: Request changed to delete another comment of a different user
threats.description: The request is changed to specify a comment id of a different comment owned by another user
threats.mitigation: Sign messages using the server's private key, or store the data privately and don't have a public entry point. Authenticate messages again (e.g. do not trust blindly the message from the server).

threats.title: Retrieval of comment deletion request
threats.description: Attacker retrieves that the user wants to delete their comment (they only know the comment ID)
threats.mitigation: N/A because this information cannot be used to threaten the user, and the user will still delete their comment

threats.title: Request to datastore intercepted
threats.description: The request to delete the comment is intercepted between the server and the datastore, failing to make it to the datastore
threats.mitigation: Store data privately without public access without the possibility of interception or use a secure transport layer protocol such as TLS.

threats.title: Modify the content of a comment
threats.description: Attacker modifies the content of a comment - may be inappropriate, rude, or break TOS.
threats.mitigation: Transport messages from client to server over a secure protocol layer (TLS), or store data privately without public entry points

threats.title: Retrieval of comment content
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the content of a comment
threats.mitigation: Encryption of packets using end to end encryption or server's private key.

threats.title: Removal of comment content
threats.description: Attacker removes content or intercepts the comment, and the comment is not posted
threats.mitigation: Send packets over a secure protocol layer (TLS) or store data privately without a public entry point

threats.title: Flooding datastore with bad messages
threats.description: Attacker floods the datastore with bad messages, overwhelming it
threats.mitigation: Do not allow the datastore to be accessed publicly (e.g. no public access points), use a firewall, and utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Comment directed at different valid note
threats.description: Attacker changes the note that a comment is written for to a note that the user can comment on (e.g. they have access to it)
threats.mitigation: Transport messages from client to server over a secure protocol layer (TLS), or store data privately without public entry points

threats.title: Comment directed at different invalid note
threats.description: Attacker changes the note that a comment is written for to a note that the user can comment on (e.g. they don't have access to it)
threats.mitigation:
Transport messages from client to server over a secure protocol layer (TLS), or store data privately without public entry points.
Validation of who is commenting on what at the datastore (rather than trusting that the server has done this).

data.name: Trust Level 1
data.description: Only the note owner has access to this process

data.name: Trust Level 1 - 3.1
data.description: comments can be added by note owner, shared users, and logged-in non-owner users (if the note is public)

threats.title: Comment created for a different user
threats.description: Attacker creates a comment for a different user
threats.mitigation: Ensure strong authentication when commenting (e.g. email the user an authentication pin)

threats.title: Comment content modified
threats.description: Attacker modifies the comment's content
threats.mitigation: Use a secure transport layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Comment modified to be on a different note
threats.description: Attacker modifies the note that the comment is associated with
threats.mitigation: Transport messages from client to server over a secure protocol layer (TLS), or store data privately without public entry points.

threats.title: User denies commenting on a note
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: Retrieval of comment content
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: Removal of note
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: Flooding of end-point
threats.description: Attacker floods server with note creation requests
threats.mitigation: Utilise DDOS protection services e.g. Cloudflare

threats.title: Elevate to Shared User
threats.description: The attacker elevates themselves from a Logged-In Non-Owner (TL3) to a Shared User (TL2), giving themselves the ability to comment on the given note.
threats.mitigation:
Have checks to stop Non-Owner/Non-Shared Users from accessing a note. 
Securely storing shared details/notes.

threats.title: Delete a comment as another user
threats.description: Attacker sends a delete comment request pretending to be another user
threats.mitigation: Require email verification using a pin

threats.title: Modify the delete comment request
threats.description: Attacker modifies a delete comment request to not delete a comment
threats.mitigation: Transport over a secure protocol such as HTTPS

threats.title: User denies deleting comment
threats.description: User denies deleting comment
threats.mitigation: Log the user's usage of the website and their verification of logging in with email (using their pin) and their verification of deleting a comment (with another pin)

threats.title: Retrieval of comment deletion
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: NA - not a threat to the user or website and deletion of comment goes through anyway

threats.title: Comment deletion request stopped
threats.description: Attacker intercepts and stops the request to remove the comment
threats.mitigation: Send messages from client to server over a secure transport layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Comment deletion end-point flooded with requests
threats.description: Attacker floods the comment deletion end-point with bad requests
threats.mitigation: Limit the number of comment deletion requests to 1 per client per second.

threats.title: Elevate to Note Owner
threats.description: The attacker elevates themselves from a Logged-In Non-Owner (TL3) to the Note Owner (TL1), giving themselves the ability to comment on the given note.
threats.mitigation:
Have checks to stop Non-Owner from accessing a note. 
Securely storing shared details/notes.

threats.title: Comment content modified
threats.description: Attacker modifies the content of a comment to be something rude/illegal/breaks TOS with phony SQL query
threats.mitigation: Store data locally without public entry points, and only accept messages signed by server

threats.title: Comment associated note modified
threats.description: Attacker changes the associated note of a comment (e.g. moves a comment from 1 note to another) with phony SQL query
threats.mitigation: Store data locally without public entry points, and only accept messages signed by server

threats.title: User denies making a comment
threats.description: User denies that they wrote a comment
threats.mitigation: Thoroughly log usage of the application, have strong authentication and log the steps of authentication

threats.title: User denies deleting a comment
threats.description: User denies that they deleted a comment
threats.mitigation: Thoroughly log usage of the application, have strong authentication and log the steps of authentication

threats.title: Internal actor retrieves comment(s)
threats.description: Attacker with internal access to datastore retrieves comment from the datastore
threats.mitigation:
Ensure those with internal access to the datastore are only permitted when they need it
Log internal access to the datastore
Encrypt comment in the datastore

threats.title: External actor retrieves comment
threats.description: External actor retrieves user comment from datastore using an SQL query
threats.mitigation: Store data locally without public entry points, and only accept messages signed by server

threats.title: SQL injection
threats.description: Attacker modifies comment(s) using SQL injection
threats.mitigation: Sanitise inputs in the server and use parameterised queries

threats.title: SQL injection
threats.description: Attacker modifies comment(s) using SQL injection
threats.mitigation: Sanitise inputs in the server and use parameterised queries

threats.title: Create note as another user
threats.description: Attacker creates a note with another user's credentials
threats.mitigation: Require email verification when creating a note - send the user a pin that they must type into the website

threats.title: User denies creating a note
threats.description: User denies creating a note
threats.mitigation: Log user usage and their authentication strongly (e.g., that they used their emailed pin to make the note)

threats.title: Access another user's note as another user
threats.description: Attacker accesses another users note using their credentials
threats.mitigation: Require a log in session token (that requires email verification) for viewing your notes

threats.title: Deny accessing a note
threats.description: User denies accessing a note
threats.mitigation: Strongly log the user usage and their email verification process

threats.title: Create a note as another user
threats.description: Attacker creates note using another user's credentials
threats.mitigation: Email verification when creating a new note

threats.title: Modify the contents of a note
threats.description: Attacker modifies the contents of a note
threats.mitigation: TODO

threats.title: User denies accessing a note
threats.description: User denies accessing a note
threats.mitigation: Log user usage of the website and their email verification process

threats.title: Retrieval of note contents
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the content of a note that another user requested
threats.mitigation: TODO

threats.title: Flooding server with bad requests
threats.description: Attacker floods server with bad requests to overwhelm it and slow down responses to legitimate users
threats.mitigation: Use a DDOS protection service to only have to handle legitimate requests

threats.title: Elevating to Note Owner
threats.description: The attacker elevates themselves from a Public Un-Authenticated User (TL4) to a Note Owner (TL1), giving themselves the ability to create.
threats.mitigation: Have checks to stop Public Un-Authenticated Users from creating a note.

threats.title: Modify the note in transit
threats.description: attacker modifies the note in transit
threats.mitigation:
Have data stored on a private network without public entry points
Send data over a secure transfer protocol (TLS)

threats.title: Note and comments retrieved
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the contents of the note and the comments on that note
threats.mitigation: Encrypt data using TLS

threats.title: Modify the comments of the note
threats.description: Attacker modifies the comments of the note
threats.mitigation:
Send over a secure transport layer (TLS)
Store data in a private network without public entry points

threats.title: Flood server with bad responses
threats.description: Attacker floods the server with bad responses that look like the response they are expecting
threats.mitigation:
Have a firewall proxy in front of the server so that only valid requests are allowed
Have datastore on a private network without public entry points

threats.title: Modifying note content
threats.description: Attacker modifies the content of the note
threats.mitigation: Send over a secure transport protocol (TLS)

threats.title: Retrieval of note and comments
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the content and comments of the note in transit
threats.mitigation: Encrypt message using server's private key

threats.title: Intercept note
threats.description: Attacker intercepts and clears or deletes the data so that the user does not receive anything
threats.mitigation: Send over a secure transport protocol (HTTPS)

data.name: Request Note
data.description:
Note can be accessed through:
- public note from main page
- shared link
- from own profile

threats.title: Modify the note id being requested
threats.description: Attacker modifies the note id being requested
threats.mitigation: Send over a secure transport layer (TLS)

threats.title: Retrieval of request
threats.description: Attacker retrieves that user want to request this note's content
threats.mitigation: Encrypt message using client's private key

threats.title: Flood server
threats.description: Attacker floods the server with a large amount of request note requests
threats.mitigation: Use DDOS protection service to prevent flooding of bad requests

threats.title: Flood requests
threats.description: Attacker floods datastore with requests
threats.mitigation:
Have a firewall proxy in front of the datastore so that only valid requests are allowed
Have datastore on a private network without public entry points

threats.title: Retrieval of note contents
threats.description: Attacker retrieves note contents
threats.mitigation:
Send over secure transport layer (TLS)
Store data in a private datastore without public entry points

threats.title: Modification of note contents
threats.description: Attacker modifies the contents of the note
threats.mitigation:
Send over secure transport layer (TLS)
Store data in a private datastore without public entry points

data.name: Trust Level 1
data.description: Note Owner trust level. A person cannot create a note that you are not the owner of.

data.name: Trust Level 1 - 3.1
data.description: a note can be accessed by Note Owner, Shared users, and logged-in non-owner users (if the note is public)

threats.title: Modify the contents of a stored note
threats.description: Attacker modifies the content of the stored note by using a phony SQL query
threats.mitigation: Only accept messages signed by the server, and store the data privately without public entry points.

threats.title: User denies accessing a note
threats.description: User denies that they accessed some note
threats.mitigation: Log their usage of the webpage, their authentication process, and have strong authentication

threats.title: Retrieve note content with phony SQL query
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the content of the stored note by using a phony SQL query
threats.mitigation: Only accept messages signed by the server, and store the data privately without public entry points.

threats.title: SQL injection
threats.description: Attacker uses SQL injection when creating a note to modify or remove other notes
threats.mitigation: Sanitise user inputs and use parameterised queries

threats.title: Flood datastore with bad requests
threats.description: Attacker floods the datastore with phony messages to slow response times drastically
threats.mitigation:
Only accept messages signed by the server, and store the data privately without public entry points
Have a firewall in front of the datastore

threats.title: SQL injection
threats.description: Attacker modifies notes(s) using SQL injection
threats.mitigation: Sanitise user inputs and use parameterised queries

threats.title: Accessing a note as another user
threats.description: Attacker accesses a note using another user's credentials
threats.mitigation: Require a log in session token (that requires email verification) for viewing your notes

threats.title: Modify the note being requested
threats.description: Attacker modifies the content of the requested note
threats.mitigation: TODO

threats.title: User denies accessing a note
threats.description: User denies that they accessed a note
threats.mitigation: Log user usage of the website, and their email verification process

threats.title: Retrieval of access note request
threats.description: Attacker retrieves that a note was requested to be retrieved
threats.mitigation: TODO

threats.title: Flood server with bad requests
threats.description: Attacker floods the server with bad requests that act as user requests
threats.mitigation: Use a DDOS prevention service so the server only handles legitimate requests

threats.title: Elevate to Shared User
threats.description: The attacker elevates themselves from a Logged-In Non-Owner trying to view a private note (TL3.2) to a Shared User with Read Access (TL2.2), giving themselves the ability to view the given note.
threats.mitigation:
Have checks to stop Non-Owner/Non-Shared Users from viewing a note. 
Securely storing shared details/notes.

data.name: Note contents
data.description:
Note can contain text, images, hyperlinks to other
webpages, and links to other notes

threats.title: Modification of note content
threats.description: Attacker modifies the content of the note
threats.mitigation: Send note over a secure transport layer (HTTPS)

threats.title: Retrieval of note content
threats.description: Attacker retrieves the content of the note
threats.mitigation: Send note over secure transport protocol (HTTPS)

threats.title: Flood server with bad requests
threats.description: Attacker floods the server with bad requests to stop the user's request from being processed
threats.mitigation: Use DDOS protection service to prevent flooding of bad requests

diagrams.title: Publish Note diagram

threats.title: Pretende to be another user
threats.description: Pretend to be a another user to make their notes public
threats.mitigation: Sign requests with users session token and insure that users are properly validated with email when logging in.

threats.title: User denies having set their note to public
threats.description: User claims another user made the set public request
threats.mitigation: Sign requests with the users private key (session token)

threats.title: capture processed information
threats.description: An attacker captures the public private information for a note mid transit.
threats.mitigation: Protect the web server by placing it in the DMZ behind a firewall. And encrypt information in transit preferably with a key only known by web server

threats.title: Flood the database
threats.description: The database server is flooded with a range of bogus requests that severely impact it's serving capabilities.
threats.mitigation: Place the database server behind a proxy firewall and in a private network not accessible from the outside

threats.title: Invalidate real requests
threats.description: Attacker modifies requests mid transit and removes signatures from them such that the server discards all requests.
threats.mitigation: monitor the frequency of invalid incoming requests and protect your network physically by not allowing unauthorized users access to your servers or networking.

threats.title: Attacker modifies data mid transit
threats.description: Attacker modifies data mid transit to the database
threats.mitigation: Sign or encrypt data sent between web server and database, physically place database on a protected network

threats.title: capture processed information
threats.description: An attacker captures the public private information for a note mid transit.
threats.mitigation: Protect the web server by placing it in the DMZ behind a firewall and the database in the protected network. And encrypt information in transit with database preferably with a key only known by web server

threats.title: Flood the database
threats.description: The database server is flooded with a range of bogus requests that severely impact it's serving capabilities.
threats.mitigation: Place the database server behind a proxy firewall and in a private network not accessible from the outside

threats.title: Invalidate real requests
threats.description: Attacker modifies requests mid transit and removes signatures from them such that the server discards all requests.
threats.mitigation: monitor the frequency of invalid incoming requests and protect your network physically by not allowing unauthorized users access to your servers or networking.

threats.title: Attacker modifies data mid transit
threats.description: Attacker modifies data mid transit to the database
threats.mitigation: Sign or encrypt data sent between web server and database, physically place database on a protected network

data.name:
Desired note
publicity
data.description: Toggle a public/private switch - sending desired state

threats.title: Note content is disclosed in transit
threats.description: Attacker steals note content
threats.mitigation: don't include sensitive content in sent messages

threats.title: Modify note number
threats.description: Change the note number such that the wrong note is retrieved
threats.mitigation: Make sure that the user has to sign the request such that it can not be modified. Also use a secure transmission sheme like https

threats.title: Flood web server
threats.description: Flood web server with bad requests
threats.mitigation: Protect the web server with a proxy firewall

data.name:
Note
Contents
and Comments
data.description: Note contents and comments

threats.title: Modify the sent note
threats.description: Change the content of the note or the comments when retrieved from the database.
threats.mitigation: sign notes sent with a private key from database or web server

threats.title: Note information is captured in transit
threats.description: attacker can copy information of a sent note
threats.mitigation: Encrypt traffic along the way with a clients public key.

threats.title: Flood web server
threats.description: Flood the web server with bad packets
threats.mitigation: Protect the webserver with a proxy firewall

data.name: Request Note
data.description:
Note can be accessed through:
- public note from main page
- shared link
- from own profile

threats.title: Modifying the note number requested
threats.description: Attacker modifies the value of the note requested
threats.mitigation: Sign the message to ensure content can't be changed without being noticed

threats.title: Attacker copies note in transit
threats.description: Attacker copies request content mid transit
threats.mitigation: ensure no sensitive data is included in requests

threats.title: Flood the web server
threats.description: Attacker floods the webserver with bad requests
threats.mitigation: Secure the web server with a proxy firewall

data.name: Trust Level 1
data.description: Can only be performed by Note Owner

data.name: Trust Level 1 - 3.1
data.description: Can be performed by Note owner, Shared users, and a logged-in, non-owner user (if the note is public)

threats.title: Pretende to be another user
threats.description: Pretend to be a another user to make their notes public
threats.mitigation: Sign requests with users session token and insure that users are properly validated with email when logging in.

threats.title: Modify process to remove authentication requirement
threats.description: An attacker circumvents the requirement for authentication by modifying the process, e.g through sql injection
threats.mitigation: Ensure all parts of this process happen on the web server and not on the clients machine. Also make sure all input is properly escaped

threats.title: Deny having followed the process
threats.description: Victim denies having requested to set their note public or confirming this
threats.mitigation: Ensure all requests are signed by the user such that they can be traced back to the user

threats.title: capture processed information
threats.description: An attacker captures the public private information for a note mid transit.
threats.mitigation: Ensure no sensitive information is sent along with a request for publicity (e.g no note content). And protect the web server by placing it in the DMZ behind a firewall.

threats.title: Flood the web server
threats.description: The web server is flooded with a range of bogus requests that severely impact it's serving capabilities.
threats.mitigation: Place the web server behind a proxy firewall

threats.title: Invalidate real requests
threats.description: Attacker modifies requests mid transit and removes signatures from them such that the server discards all requests.
threats.mitigation: monitor the frequency of invalid incoming requests and protect your network physically by not allowing unauthorized users access to your servers or networking.

threats.title: Attacker modifies someone elses note
threats.description: Attacker provides valid credentials for themselves and tries to modify someone else's note
threats.mitigation: Check users are privileged to modify a note at the database and do not grant other users modification rights to others notes when they don't need them (not even admins).

threats.title: User denies sharing note
threats.description: User disputes having shared a note and claims someone else has done this
threats.mitigation: Create logs of changes to the public status and sign these with the users private key (session token)

threats.title: Threat actor tampers with database
threats.description: Send a request to the database from a different application (not the web app)
threats.mitigation: Isolate the website on a separate private network together with the web server for the application and sign the requests with a private key from the web server.

threats.title: Read out database
threats.description: A threat actor sends data requests to the database to retrieve stored records
threats.mitigation: Sign any requests by the front end and do not include endpoints that read out more data than any part of the application would need

threats.title: Flood database
threats.description: Send floods of bad requests to the database to block it's functionality
threats.mitigation: put the database on a protected network behind a firewall and connect it to the web server in the companies DMZ this way.

threats.title: SQL injection
threats.description: Attacker modifies note(s) to be private/public using SQL injection
threats.mitigation: Sanitise user inputs and use parameterised queries

threats.title: SQL injection
threats.description: Attacker modifies note(s) to be private using SQL injection
threats.mitigation: Sanitise user inputs and use parameterised queries

threats.title: capture processed information
threats.description: An attacker captures the public private information for a note mid transit.
threats.mitigation: Protect the web server by placing it in the DMZ behind a firewall. And encrypt information in transit preferably with a key only known by the receiving user.

threats.title: Flood the web server
threats.description: The web server is flooded with a range of bogus requests that severely impact it's serving capabilities.
threats.mitigation: Place the web server behind a proxy firewall

threats.title: Invalidate real requests
threats.description: Attacker modifies requests mid transit and removes signatures from them such that the server discards all requests.
threats.mitigation: monitor the frequency of invalid incoming requests and protect your network physically by not allowing unauthorized users access to your servers or networking.

threats.title: Attacker modifies someone elses note
threats.description: Attacker provides valid credentials for themselves and tries to trick the server into believing they are allowed to access a note.
threats.mitigation: Store the permissions list for a note with a signature from the original owner to note any tampering

threats.title: Pretend to be a user that is allowed to view a note
threats.description: A malicious user pretends to be someone else to view their information
threats.mitigation: ensure that data sent needs to be signed with the users private key (session token)

threats.title: Remove share requirement
threats.description: Remove the processes requirement to require authentication to view someone else's note
threats.mitigation: Ensure that a users is allowed to view a note at the database level which should never be accessible from outside the network.

threats.title: User denies having looked at a note
threats.description: User denies having looked at a note
threats.mitigation: Keep loggs with users signatures that show what note was accessed when

diagrams.description: Presents publishing and viewing a note
